snippet: Maternity care and childbirth cost far more in the United States than in other developed countries, but studies show that their citizens do not have less access to care during pregnancy than Americans.
abstract: Studies show that maternity care and childbirth remain uniquely expensive in United States, despite fact that women do not have better access to care than in other developed countries; details of the pregnancy of Renee Martin of Laconia, New Hampshire, illustrate harsh realities faced by expecting mothers whose insurance does not cover maternity care (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).
lead_paragraph: Maternity care and childbirth cost far more in the United States than in other developed countries, but studies show that their citizens do not have less access to care during pregnancy than Americans.

headline.print_headline: American Way of Birth, Costliest in the World
headline.main: American Way of Birth, Costliest in the World
